data <- read_csv(file = "Spotify_Youtube.csv")
New names:
Rows: 20718 Columns: 28

mrf_songs2 <- data %>%
  filter(str_detect(Artist, "Kings of Leon|The Killers|M83|Dua Lipa|Fleetwood Mac|Sia|Daft Punk|U2|Arcade Fire|The Strokes"))
(corr_df <-mrf_songs2 %>%
  select(Artist,Danceability:Duration_ms) %>%
  pivot_longer(cols = Danceability:Duration_ms,
               names_to = "Params",
               values_to = "Vals") %>%
  pivot_wider(names_from = Artist,values_from = Vals) %>%
  unnest() %>%
  select(-Params) %>%
  correlate(method = "spearman",diagonal = 0))
Warning: Values from `Vals` are not uniquely identified; output will contain list-cols.
* Use `values_fn = list` to suppress this warning.
* Use `values_fn = {summary_fun}` to summarise duplicates.
* Use the following dplyr code to identify duplicates.
  {data} %>%
  dplyr::group_by(Params, Artist) %>%
  dplyr::summarise(n = dplyr::n(), .groups = "drop") %>%
  dplyr::filter(n > 1L)
Warning: `cols` is now required when using `unnest()`.
i Please use `cols = c(`Daft Punk`, Sia, `Fleetwood Mac`, U2, `The Strokes`,
  M83, `The Killers`, `Kings of Leon`, `Arcade Fire`, `Dua Lipa`)`.
Correlation computed with
* Method: 'spearman'
* Missing treated using: 'pairwise.complete.obs'

# ... with 1 more variable: `Dua Lipa` <dbl>, and abbreviated variable names
#   1: `Daft Punk`, 2: `Fleetwood Mac`, 3: `The Strokes`, 4: `The Killers`,
#   5: `Kings of Leon`, 6: `Arcade Fire`
final_df <- corr_df %>%
  pivot_longer(cols = -term,
               names_to = "term2",
               values_to = "cor") %>%
  mutate(vertice = case_when(
    cor > 0.85 ~ 1,
    TRUE~0
  ))
final_mat <- final_df %>%
  filter(vertice == 1) %>%
  select(term,term2) %>%
  as.matrix()
cor_vec <-  final_df %>%
  filter(vertice == 1) %>%
  pull(cor)
png(filename = "day17_finalplot.png",width = 3500,height = 2500,bg = "white",res = 600)

arcplot(final_mat,
        vertices = corr_df$term,
        col.nodes = c("#d5b76f",
                      "#fe3bd1",
                      "#efd893",
                      "#586a60",
                      "#30b5e9",
                      "#2880bc",
                      "#ab4841",
                      "#749e97",
                      "grey10",
                      "#e187a8"),
        col.arcs = hsv(0, 0, 0.2, 0.15),
        cex.nodes = log(c(3,6,4,4,1,0,6,3,0,7)+1)+.5,
        lwd.arcs = log(cor_vec,base = .99)/1.5)
dev.off()
